uk.ac.ncl.jcarlton.app

Class RentalManagement

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ncl.jcarlton.app.RentalManagement

  • public final class RentalManagement
extends java.lang.Object

    Car Rental Management

    This is the class that the Car Rental Company will use to manage their car rentals - essentially the front-end to the entire project.

    Author:
    Jonathan Carlton
    See Also:
    Car

    • Method Detail

      • availableCars

        public int availableCars(java.lang.Class<?> type)
        Given the class type, count how many cars are available to be rented.
        Parameters:
        type - either SmallCar or LargeCar, if a class of another type is passed then the method will just return -1.
        Returns:
        the count of either SmallCar or LargeCar or -1 if the class type is anything else.

      • getRentedCars

        public java.util.List<Car> getRentedCars()
        Get a collection containing all the Car's that are currently rented.
        Returns:
        List<Car> of all rented Car's

      • getCar

        public Car getCar(Person person)
        Given a Person fetch the car that they have rented from the rental company.

        Note: Can return null if the Car doesn't exist.

        Parameters:
        person - the Person who has rented a car.
        Returns:
        the Car which they have rented.

      • issueCar

        public boolean issueCar(Person person,
                        DrivingLicense license,
                        Car car)
        The functionality to issue a Car to a Person, given their driving license and the Car in which you would like to rent to them.

        This will return false (the Car isn't able to be issued) in a number of cases:

        • The license doesn't belong to the Person being passed
        • The Person is already renting a Car
        • The Person doesn't hold a full driving license
        • The tank (of the Car that is to be rented) isn't full
        • If they aren't older enough to rent the Car (Large = 25+ and Small = 20+)
        • The Person hasn't held their license for long enough (Large = 5 years+ and Small = 2 years+)

        Note: There is an assumption that the person using this method will input Cars that do exist in the rental system.

        Parameters:
        person - the person who wants to rent a car
        license - the driving license of the person
        car - the car that the person wants to rent large or small
        Returns:
        if they have been success in renting the car, true or false (see above)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when one of the parameters passed is a null object.
        See Also:
        Person, DrivingLicense, Car, SmallCar, LargeCar

      • terminateRental

        public int terminateRental(Person person)
        The functionality to terminate a rental agreement between the rental company and a given person.
        Parameters:
        person - the person who wants to terminate their rental contract.
        Returns:
        the amount of fuel required to fill the car's tank or -1 if the person attempts to terminate a non-existent contract.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the parameter passed to the method is a null value.
